title: Strictly Come Dancing week 5: the body language - how Viscountess Weymouth pulled off a triumph and Neil’s psychological trick with Alex Scott paid off
text:
Miracles are very fickle things on Strictly. Last week serial no-hoper David James was told he had flouted the odds and somehow become a dancer at last. This week he un-became one, producing a jive flat of foot enough to force the cliché out of his mouth that is always the death-knell of contestant hope on the show: "But I really enjoyed myself". The basic idea, David, is for the viewers to enjoy the routine too. If we just wanted to see a man enjoying himself on our screens, we’d all have Oliver Letwin’s beaming face playing on a loop.

After the fairy-tale blip of last week, when David could suddenly shimmy with the best of them and he and Mike Bushell were suffering vertigo from their places...
description: Miracles are very fickle things on Strictly.
